title-group.article-title: A B-SPLINE-LIKE BASIS FOR THE POWELL-SABIN 12-SPLIT BASED ON SIMPLEX SPLINES

abstract.p: We introduce a simplex spline basis for a space of C¹-quadratics on the well-known Powell-Sabin 12-split triangular region. Among its many important desirable properties, we show that it has an associated recurrence relation for evaluation and differentiation. Also developed are a Marsden-like identity, quasi-interpolants, approximation methods exhibiting unconditional stability, a subdivision scheme, and smoothness conditions across macro-element edges.
